definitions.definition: An institution , building , or room for the exhibition and conservation of important objects, especially works of art .
examples: In the gallery are displayed genuine artifacts dug up from the site, and in the gift shop you can buy a replica as a souvenir.
Some of her work is so impressive that it really ought to be in a gallery .

definitions.definition: An establishment that buys , sells , and displays works of art.
examples: Some of her best work can be yours: it is available at a gallery , if you can afford it.

definitions.definition: The uppermost seating area projecting from the rear or side walls of a theater , concert hall , or auditorium .
examples: We could afford the less expensive seats in the gallery .

definitions.definition: The spectators at an event , collectively.
examples: The politician was clearly appealing to the gallery

definitions.definition: The part of a courtroom , often elevated and in the rear, where seating for the public audience is facilitated during trial.
A roofed promenade , especially one extending along the wall of a building and supported by arches or columns on the outer side.
examples: elegant galleries looking out onto manicured gardens

definitions.definition: A browsable collection of images , font styles , etc.
examples: a clip-art gallery in a word processor

definitions.definition: A covered passage cut through the earth or masonry.
A level or drive in a mine.
A channel that carries engine oil to parts of the engine that need lubrication, such as the main bearings .
A part of a light fixture , forming part of its structure and often providing the mounting for the diffuser .
A part of a monocle —a projection off the ring holding the lens —which helps secure the monocle in the eye socket .
examples: adjusting the distance between the bottom gallery and the top gallery

definitions.definition: The boring trails produced by an insect in wood .

main_definition: An institution , building , or room for the exhibition and conservation of important objects, especially works of art .
secondary_definitions: An establishment that buys , sells , and displays works of art.
The uppermost seating area projecting from the rear or side walls of a theater , concert hall , or auditorium .
( by extension , metonymic ) The spectators at an event , collectively.
( law ) The part of a courtroom , often elevated and in the rear, where seating for the public audience is facilitated during trial.
A roofed promenade , especially one extending along the wall of a building and supported by arches or columns on the outer side.
( computing ) A browsable collection of images , font styles , etc.
( fortification ) A covered passage cut through the earth or masonry.
( mining ) A level or drive in a mine.
( automotive ) A channel that carries engine oil to parts of the engine that need lubrication, such as the main bearings .
A part of a light fixture , forming part of its structure and often providing the mounting for the diffuser .
A part of a monocle —a projection off the ring holding the lens —which helps secure the monocle in the eye socket .
( entomology ) The boring trails produced by an insect in wood .
